skill.name: clinical-decision-support
skill.description: Generate professional clinical decision support (CDS) documents for pharmaceutical and clinical research settings, including patient cohort analyses (biomarker-stratified with outcomes) and treatment recommendation reports (evidence-based guidelines with decision algorithms). Supports GRADE evidence grading, statistical analysis (hazard ratios, survival curves, waterfall plots), biomarker integration, and regulatory compliance. Outputs publication-ready LaTeX/PDF format optimized for drug development, clinical research, and evidence synthesis.
skill.summary: Generate professional clinical decision support (CDS) documents for pharmaceutical and clinical rese...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation and data analysis skill with no network access, no credential theft risks, and no persistence mechanisms. Python scripts perform only local data processing (CSV analysis, statistical calculations, LaTeX generation). All file operations are confined to user-specified output directories.

content.value_statement: Create evidence-based clinical documents for pharmaceutical research and healthcare settings. This skill produces biomarker-stratified cohort analyses, treatment recommendation reports with GRADE methodology, and publication-ready statistical summaries.
actual_capabilities: Generate biomarker-stratified patient cohort analyses with statistical comparisons
Create evidence-based treatment recommendation reports using GRADE methodology
Produce Kaplan-Meier survival curves with log-rank tests and hazard ratios
Build clinical decision algorithm flowcharts in TikZ/LaTeX format
Validate documents for HIPAA compliance and statistical reporting standards
Generate publication-ready tables for demographics, efficacy, and safety outcomes
limitations: Does not provide medical advice or clinical decision-making for individual patients
Does not access external databases or clinical trial registries
Does not validate biomarker assay accuracy or clinical cut-points
Requires user-provided patient data in CSV format for statistical analyses

use_cases.title: Drug Development Analysis
use_cases.description: Analyze biomarker-stratified patient cohorts from clinical trial data to support regulatory submissions and drug development decisions.

use_cases.title: KOL Education Materials
use_cases.description: Create evidence-based treatment algorithms and clinical guideline documents for key opinion leader education and advisory boards.

use_cases.title: Treatment Guidelines
use_cases.description: Synthesize evidence from multiple trials to develop GRADE-graded treatment recommendations for medical society guidelines.

output_examples.input: Generate cohort analysis for 45 HER2+ breast cancer patients stratified by hormone receptor status including ORR, median PFS, and 12-month OS rates with statistical comparisons.
output: Median PFS | 16.2 months | 22.1 months | HR 0.68 (0.41-1.12), p=0.13
**Key Finding**: Numerically superior outcomes in HR-/HER2+ subgroup did not reach statistical significance.

best_practices: Always include executive summary on page 1 with colored tcolorbox highlighting key findings
Use GRADE notation (1A, 1B, 2A, 2B, 2C) to clearly communicate recommendation strength
Validate documents for HIPAA Safe Harbor de-identification before distribution
anti_patterns: Do not generate recommendations for individual patient care (use treatment-plans skill)
Do not include real patient identifiers in documents (HIPAA violation)
Do not make treatment decisions based solely on cohort analyses without clinical judgment

faq.question: What data format is required for cohort analysis?
faq.answer: CSV files with patient_id, group, time, event, and outcome columns. Optional columns include biomarker values and demographic variables.

faq.question: Can this skill create documents for regulatory submissions?
faq.answer: Yes. Outputs follow pharmaceutical industry standards with GRADE methodology, HIPAA compliance, and publication-ready LaTeX formatting.

faq.question: Does the skill validate clinical recommendations?
faq.answer: The validate_cds_document.py script checks for evidence citations, GRADE notation, statistical reporting, and HIPAA identifiers.

faq.question: How does this differ from treatment-plans skill?
faq.answer: Clinical decision support focuses on population-level analyses for research and guidelines, while treatment-plans creates individual patient care plans.

faq.question: What statistical methods are supported?
faq.answer: Kaplan-Meier survival curves, log-rank tests, Cox regression, hazard ratios, chi-square tests, Fisher's exact test, and confidence intervals.

faq.question: Are network connections required?
faq.answer: No. All processing is local. Python scripts use pandas, numpy, scipy, and lifelines for offline data analysis.
